meanings.definition: Continuing or occurring again and again for a long time
meanings.sent1: Her chronic lateness always made her miss the bus.
meanings.sent2: The chronic rain in the region led to flooding.
meanings.sent3: His chronic forgetfulness turned into a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The chronic traffic congestion felt like a never-ending maze.
meanings.sent5: The chronic noise from the construction site was unbearable.

meanings.sent1: The chronic movie marathon lasted all weekend.
meanings.sent2: The chronic drought affected the crops for months.
meanings.sent3: The chronic line at the ice cream truck was worth the wait.
meanings.sent4: The chronic silence in the library was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The chronic pain in her knee made it hard to walk.

meanings.definition: Marked by long duration or frequent recurrence
meanings.sent1: The chronic power outages in the area frustrated the residents.
meanings.sent2: His chronic coughing kept everyone awake at night.
meanings.sent3: The chronic jokes from the comedian had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The chronic problems with the computer system caused delays.
meanings.sent5: The chronic barking of the neighbor's dog was driving him crazy.
